symc.name: READ_CONTROL
symc.desc: Required to read information in the security descriptor for the object, not including the information in the SACL. To read or write the SACL, you must request the ACCESS_SYSTEM_SECURITY access right. For more information, see SACL Access Right.

symc.name: SYNCHRONIZE
symc.desc: The right to use the object for synchronization. This enables a thread to wait until the object is in the signaled state.

symc.name: WRITE_DAC
symc.desc: Required to modify the DACL in the security descriptor for the object.

symc.name: WRITE_OWNER
symc.desc: Required to change the owner in the security descriptor for the object.

symc.name: EVENT_ALL_ACCESS
symc.desc: All possible access rights for an event object. Use this right only if your application requires access beyond that granted by the standard access rights and EVENT_MODIFY_STATE. Using this access right increases the possibility that your application must be run by an Administrator.

symc.name: EVENT_MODIFY_STATE
symc.desc: Modify state access, which is required for the SetEvent, ResetEvent and PulseEvent functions.

symc.name: MUTEX_ALL_ACCESS
symc.desc: All possible access rights for a mutex object. Use this right only if your application requires access beyond that granted by the standard access rights. Using this access right increases the possibility that your application must be run by an Administrator.

symc.name: SEMAPHORE_ALL_ACCESS
symc.desc: All possible access rights for a semaphore object. Use this right only if your application requires access beyond that granted by the standard access rights and SEMAPHORE_MODIFY_STATE. Using this access right increases the possibility that your application must be run by an Administrator.

symc.name: SEMAPHORE_MODIFY_STATE
symc.desc: Modify state access, which is required for the ReleaseSemaphore function.

symc.name: TIMER_ALL_ACCESS
symc.desc: All possible access rights for a waitable timer object. Use this right only if your application requires access beyond that granted by the standard access rights and TIMER_MODIFY_STATE. Using this access right increases the possibility that your application must be run by an Administrator.

symc.name: TIMER_MODIFY_STATE
symc.desc: Modify state access, which is required for the SetWaitableTimer and CancelWaitableTimer functions.
